results.title: The Crying Game
results.creator_credit: John Wood and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.
This story made by John Wood talks about his uncontrallable bouts of crying. This is sometimes brought about by depression or anxiety. He has learned that the expression of emotion is very healthy.

results.title: Kyara
results.creator_credit: Hank Kerr and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.
This film is a message from Hank Kerr to his daughter, Kyara. It speaks about his alcoholism and determination to become a better person for the sake of his daughter. Kerr also talks about the jobs he has had including as a clown in the first Aboriginal Clown troop called the Oogadee Boogadees.

results.title: Rosalie Kunoth-Monks portrait
results.credit_line: Courtesy the National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: Due to Jedda’s popularity and interest in Aboriginal ‘kitsch’ and culture, Arrernte actress Kunoth-Monks and Jedda became entwined. But she never acted again, instead becoming an advocate for Australia’s First Peoples.
results.credit_line_for_label: Courtesy the National Film and Sound Archive of Australia

results.title: Imparja Television satellite footprint
results.brief_description: In 1998, the Central Australian Aboriginal Media Association (CAAMA) launched the world’s first Indigenous owned and operated TV network, Imparja Television. Along with the establishment of Indigenous Community Television (ICTV) in 2001, these early initiatives paved the way for today’s broadcasters.

results.title: Live broadcast at the launch of EVTV
results.credit_line: Courtesy Rex Guthrie / PY Media / Ara Irititja Archive
results.brief_description:
EVTV live broadcast to Ernabella (Pukatja) community, 1985

Pantjiti McKenzie OAM presents a live broadcast during the launch of “Ernabella Video Television” (EVTV) to Pukatja community (Ernabella) in the Pitjantjatjara Lands of South Australia.
results.title_for_label: Live broadcast at the launch of EVTV
results.description:
